page.title: 17WHALTON C of E AIDED SCHOOL
page.content: Built in 1831, the school originally provided education for children up to age 14. In the late fifties the roll reached a maximum of 65 and in 1959 it became a Primary School. With the introduction of a three tier education system in 1970 it became a First School. The roll fell to 15 pupils in the early eighties and in consequence there was a reduction from 2 full-time teachers to 1 full-time and 1 part -time. There are now 20 pupils. Rumours frequently circulate about closure and this causes some parents to send their children to other schools exacerbating the problem of falling rolls. However, 40% of the children come from outside the official catchment area indicating that the parents of these children feel that they will get a better education in a small, rural school.
